nl.inl.blacklab.index.annotated

Class AnnotationWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.inl.blacklab.index.annotated.AnnotationWriter

  • public class AnnotationWriter
extends Object
    An annotation in an annotated field (while indexing). See AnnotatedFieldWriter for details.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  AnnotationWriter.SensitivitySetting
      How an annotation is to be indexed with respect to case and diacritics sensitivity.

    • Field Detail

      • includeOffsets

        protected boolean includeOffsets

      • values

        protected List<String> values
        Term values for this annotation.

      • increments

        protected org.eclipse.collections.impl.list.mutable.primitive.IntArrayList increments
        Token position increments. This allows us to index multiple terms at a single token position (just set the token increments of the additional tokens to 0).

      • payloads

        protected List<org.apache.lucene.util.BytesRef> payloads
        Payloads for this annotation, if any.

      • lastValuePosition

        protected int lastValuePosition
        Position of the last value added

    • Constructor Detail

      • AnnotationWriter

        public AnnotationWriter(AnnotatedFieldWriter fieldWriter,
                        String name,
                        AnnotationWriter.SensitivitySetting sensitivity,
                        boolean includeOffsets,
                        boolean includePayloads)
        Construct a AnnotationWriter object
        Parameters:
        fieldWriter - fieldwriter for our field
        name - annotation name
        sensitivity - ways to index this annotation, with respect to case- and diacritics-sensitivity.
        includeOffsets - whether to include character offsets in the main sensitivity variant
        includePayloads - will this annotation include payloads?

      • addValue

        public void addValue(String value,
                     int increment)
        Add a value to the annotation.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to add
        increment - number of tokens distance from the last token added

      • addValueAtPosition

        public int addValueAtPosition(String value,
                              int position)
        Add a value to the annotation at a specific position. Please note that if you add a value beyond the current position, the next call to addValue() will add from this new position! This is not an issue if you add a value at a lower position (that operation doesn't change the current last token position used for addValue()).
        Parameters:
        value - the value to add
        position - the position to put it at
        Returns:
        new position of the last token, in case it changed.
